thinking.disposable_income: Central Northwest has a moderate median household income around $45,000, with about 25% of residents living below poverty level, indicating limited disposable income for many residents.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the moderate-to-low income levels, residents have limited discretionary spending capacity and are sensitive to additional transportation costs and taxes.
thinking.accessibility: The area has decent bus service along major corridors but many residents rely on personal vehicles, with about 75% of commuters driving alone to work and average commute times of 25-30 minutes.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized proposals with lower transit fares ($0.75) to help transit-dependent residents while maintaining service quality 2) Favored moderate tax rates (1%) to balance revenue needs with household budget impacts 3) Supported modest driving fees ($0.50) to encourage transit use without overly burdening drivers 4) Selected options that reduce both transit and driving times 5) Considered the combined impact of taxes, fares, and fees on household budgets
